meanings.definition: A person who begs for money or food.
meanings.sent1: The beggars on the street asked for spare change.
meanings.sent2: The city had many beggars who relied on the kindness of others.
meanings.sent3: The beggars in the park shared a laugh as they asked for help.
meanings.sent4: The image of the beggars under the bridge haunted his dreams.
meanings.sent5: The beggars' plea for help echoed through the alleyways.

meanings.sent1: The economic crisis beggars many families in the country.
meanings.sent2: Unexpected medical bills can beggars even the most financially stable individuals.
meanings.sent3: His reckless spending habits beggars belief.
meanings.sent4: The natural disaster beggars the once thriving community.
meanings.sent5: The loss of his job beggars him overnight.
